p: The plant tissues (roots, stems, and leaves) were introduced to three kinds of pretreatment in order to kill bacteria and isolate of endophytic actinobacteria following the method of Qin et al. (2011) with some modification: (1) surface sterilized plant tissues were directly taken to isolation; (2) freezing treatment involved plant tissues being frozen at –80 °C for 2 weeks; (3) high temperature treatment involved plant tissues drying at 100°C for 20 min.
